javadoc: A class to represent a new-executable segment.

methods.javadoc:
Returns segment ID.
@return segment ID
methods.name: getSegmentID
methods.comment: Returns segment ID.

return.comment: segment ID

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if the segment should operate in 32 bit mode.
@return true if the segment should operate in 32 bit mode
methods.name: is32bit
methods.comment: Returns true if the segment should operate in 32 bit mode.

return.comment: true if the segment should operate in 32 bit mode

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this is a code segment.
@return true if this is a code segment
methods.name: isCode
methods.comment: Returns true if this is a code segment.

return.comment: true if this is a code segment

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this is a data segment.
@return true if this is a data segment
methods.name: isData
methods.comment: Returns true if this is a data segment.

return.comment: true if this is a data segment

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this segment has relocations.
@return true if this segment has relocations
methods.name: hasRelocation
methods.comment: Returns true if this segment has relocations.

return.comment: true if this segment has relocations

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this segment is loader allocated.
@return true if this segment is loader allocated
methods.name: isLoaderAllocated
methods.comment: Returns true if this segment is loader allocated.

return.comment: true if this segment is loader allocated

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this segment is loaded.
@return true if this segment is loaded
methods.name: isLoaded
methods.comment: Returns true if this segment is loaded.

return.comment: true if this segment is loaded

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this segment is moveable.
@return true if this segment is moveable
methods.name: isMoveable
methods.comment: Returns true if this segment is moveable.

return.comment: true if this segment is moveable

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this segment is preloaded.
@return true if this segment is preloaded
methods.name: isPreload
methods.comment: Returns true if this segment is preloaded.

return.comment: true if this segment is preloaded

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this segment is pure.
@return true if this segment is pure
methods.name: isPure
methods.comment: Returns true if this segment is pure.

return.comment: true if this segment is pure

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this segment is read-only.
@return true if this segment is read-only
methods.name: isReadOnly
methods.comment: Returns true if this segment is read-only.

return.comment: true if this segment is read-only

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this segment is execute-only.
@return true if this segment is execute-only
methods.name: isExecuteOnly
methods.comment: Returns true if this segment is execute-only.

return.comment: true if this segment is execute-only

methods.javadoc:
Returns true if this segment is discardable.
@return true if this segment is discardable
methods.name: isDiscardable
methods.comment: Returns true if this segment is discardable.

return.comment: true if this segment is discardable

methods.javadoc:
Returns the flag word of this segment.
@return the flag word of this segment
methods.name: getFlagword
methods.comment: Returns the flag word of this segment.

return.comment: the flag word of this segment

methods.javadoc:
Returns the length of this segment.
@return the length of this segment
methods.name: getLength
methods.comment: Returns the length of this segment.

return.comment: the length of this segment

methods.javadoc:
Returns the minimum allocation size of this segment.
@return the minimum allocation size of this segment
methods.name: getMinAllocSize
methods.comment: Returns the minimum allocation size of this segment.

return.comment: the minimum allocation size of this segment

methods.name: getOffset
methods.comment:
Returns the offset to the contents of this segment. 
 NOTE: This value needs to be shift aligned.

return.comment: the offset to the contents of this segment

methods.javadoc:
Returns the actual (shifted) offset to the contents.
@return the actual (shifted) offset to the contents
methods.name: getOffsetShiftAligned
methods.comment: Returns the actual (shifted) offset to the contents.

return.comment: the actual (shifted) offset to the contents

methods.javadoc:
Returns an array of the relocations defined for this segment.
@return an array of the relocations defined for this segment
methods.name: getRelocations
methods.comment: Returns an array of the relocations defined for this segment.

return.comment: an array of the relocations defined for this segment

methods.name: getBytes
methods.comment:
Returns the bytes the comprise this segment.
 The size of the byte array is MAX(length,minalloc).

return.comment: the bytes the comprise this segment

name: Segment
comment: A class to represent a new-executable segment.
